current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate certain segments of East Rosebud Creek in
			 Carbon
			 County, Montana, as components of the Wild and Scenic Rivers System.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: East Rosebud Wild and Scenic Rivers Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: East Rosebud Wild and Scenic Rivers Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: East Rosebud Wild and Scenic Rivers Act/s:2/ss:a/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , for future generations to enjoy; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: East Rosebud Wild and Scenic Rivers Act/s:2/ss:a/p:2

text.#text: merits the high level of protection afforded by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in order to maintain the benefits provided by the Creek, as described
			 in

text.#text: designation of select public land segments of East Rosebud Creek under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
would recognize the importance of maintaining the values of the Creek
			 while preserving public access, respecting private property rights,
			 allowing appropriate maintenance of existing infrastructure, and allowing
			 historical uses of the Creek to
			 continue.

text.#text:
The purpose of this Act is to designate East Rosebud Creek in the State of Montana as a
		component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System to  preserve and protect
			 for present and future generations the outstandingly remarkable scenic,
			 wildlife, fishery recreational, geologic, and historical values of the
			 Creek.

header.#text: Designation of wild and scenic river segments

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 3(a) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act

text.#text: The portions of East Rosebud Creek in the State of Montana, consisting of—

the 13-mile segment from the source in the Absaroka-Beartooth Wilderness downstream to the point at
			 which the Creek enters East Rosebud Lake, including the stream reach
			 between Twin Outlets Lake and Fossil Lake,
			 to be administered by the

the 7-mile segment on the Custer National Forest from immediately below, but not including, the
			 outlet of East Rosebud Lake
			 downstream to the point at which the Creek enters private property for the
			 first time,
			 to be administered by the
No private property shall be included within the boundaries of the river segments designated by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: paragraph (208) of section 3(a) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act
There are authorized to be appropriated

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(including
			 the amendments made by this Act)
